newsitem.title: UK: TENNIS-SELES STRUGGLES BEFORE RAIN HALTS DAY'S PLAY.
newsitem.headline: TENNIS-SELES STRUGGLES BEFORE RAIN HALTS DAY'S PLAY.

text.p: World number two Monica Seles struggled in cold, windy conditions against eighth seed Brenda Schultz-McCarthy before rain set in to give her a respite at the Eastbourne women's grasscourt championships on Thursday.
Seles, the defending champion and top seed in the traditional Wimbledon warm-up, was trailing 5-7 2-2 in the quarter-final match when the skies opened and play was halted.
Steady rain continued all afternoon, persuading organisers to postpone the quarter-finals until Friday in the hope of brighter weather. The semifinals are also due to be played on Friday.
Natasha Zvereva of Belarus won the opening set of her quarter-final against Frenchwoman Nathalie Tauziat 7-5 on court two before the rain began.

Play had started three hours late on Thursday because of earlier showers and the delay initially seemed to favour Seles who steamed to a 4-1 lead over the 1.88-metre tall Schultz-McCarthy on Devonshire Park's centre court.
The Dutchwoman is the hardest server on the women's tour but she took time to fine-tune her serve, double-faulting to give away the first break in the fourth game.
But once she had got her serve in full working order she began to trouble Seles and provoked her into errors which led to two breaks and a 6-5 lead for Schultz-McCarthy.
The second set was going with serve until the match was interrupted after 41 minutes of play.
In the other quarter-finals fourth-seeded Spaniard Arantxa Sanchez Vicario plays Romanian Irina Spirlea and Japan's Ai Sugiyama meets second seed Jana Novotna of the Czech Republic.
